info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 2:10PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Otero County through 245 PM MDT... At 210 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Lake Mescalero, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sierra Blanca Peak and Three Rivers Petroglyph Site. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
